answers.answer: Someone can volunteer to help vulnerable people coming to Romania by offering support with food, products, clothing, transportation, or by volunteering their time.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Offer support'.

answers.answer: If you need specialized medical assistance for a rare or chronic condition, you can find out where to ask for help on the website.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Health'.

answers.answer: Support is available for finding temporary accommodation for vulnerable people, and individuals can also offer a space to help those coming to Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Housing'.

answers.answer: Individuals can find suitable job opportunities in Romania by accessing information on how and where to find them.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Jobs'.

answers.answer: Information is available on education rights in Romania for Ukrainians, including how to enroll children in school, kindergarten, or extracurricular activities, and details about Ukrainian schools.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: Specialized call-centers provide access to resources, information, and dedicated support by allowing users to call one based on their specific needs.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Call-center'.

answers.answer: Pro bono legal help is available for Ukrainian refugees in Romania and other countries.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Legal help'.

answers.answer: One can find out how to get transportation or technical assistance for their vehicle in an emergency situation on the website.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Transport'.

answers.answer: A list of free language courses and activities for Ukrainian refugees in Romania is offered, available for both children and adults.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Language courses and activities'.

answers.answer: Individuals who have used drugs and now need help can look for services that they can access on the website.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Support for drug users'.

answers.answer: Mental health services are available for refugees from Ukraine to help them talk openly about war trauma and more easily manage its effects on their well-being.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Mental health services for refugees from Ukraine'.

answers.answer: The online map created by UNHCR can be used to find a list of organizations that provide various kinds of assistance to refugees from Ukraine.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Map of organizations helping refugees from Ukraine'.

answers.answer: The website provides information to learn more about the process of integrating refugees from Ukraine into Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Integration of refugees from Ukraine to Romania'.

answers.answer: Through Sprijin de Urgență, one can request or provide resources such as food, products, clothing, tents, transportation, or volunteers.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Sprijin de Urgență'.
